intro: Blennosperma californicum, commonly known as the California blennosperma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in coastal and inland desert regions, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
